ETYMOLOGY: From Hindi banglā 'belonging to Bengal', referring to a house built in the Bengali style, adopted into English via Anglo-Indian.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A low-built, single-story house, often with a porch.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种低矮的单层房屋，通常带有门廊。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They decided to buy a charming bungalow near the lake for their retirement.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们决定在湖边买一栋迷人的平房以供退休。
